2023-04-29T14:37:51Z:
The bad news? That's it for live coverage on today's F1 action.
The good news? We get to do it all over again tomorrow for the full-fat grand prix. The Azerbaijan GP starts at 12pm BST so don't miss out.
Until then, have a lovely rest of your Saturday. Go well!
2023-04-29T14:32:52Z: Here's the full report on the opening F1 sprint race of the season:https://www.autosport.com/f1/news/f1-azerbaijan-gp-perez-overtakes-leclerc-for-sprint-race-win/10462578/
2023-04-29T14:24:59Z: It looks like the biggest talking point will be that first-lap battle between Verstappen and Russell and then the exchange of views between the pair in the pitlane.
2023-04-29T14:23:14Z: So, what did you make of the first sprint race of the season? Did the new format make a difference? The full picture might not be clear until after the grand prix tomorrow, but we'd love to hear your thoughts.
2023-04-29T14:19:09Z: Rather than caps, medal or wreaths for sprint race wins, this year the top three finishers are getting small plaques for their efforts. I'm sure that'll make for a great paperweight.
2023-04-29T14:12:42Z: Verstappen parks up in third place in the pits and it reveals the extent of his damage - he has a massive hole on the left sidepod.
2023-04-29T14:10:44Z: Albon just missed out on a point in ninth, ahead of Piastri, Magnussen, Zhou, Gasly, De Vries, Hulkenberg, Bottas, Norris and Ocon. Tsunoda the only retirement, with Sargeant the DNS-er.
2023-04-29T14:08:36Z: Russell takes fourth, ahead of Sainz, Alonso, Hamilton and Stroll who complete the sprint points places. The top four teams lockout all of the points places.
2023-04-29T14:07:40Z: Perez wins the Azerbaijan GP sprint race - and Leclerc holds on to second by 0.6s ahead of Verstappen!
2023-04-29T14:06:20Z: Final lap time, Perez's lead is up to 4.7s on Leclerc and Verstappen is within a second now - can he nab second before the finish?
2023-04-29T14:04:21Z: Perez has checked out at the front with his lead at 3.2s with two laps to go. Verstappen is still, just, outside of DRS range of Leclerc in the fight for second.
2023-04-29T14:03:33Z: De Vries darts by Hulkenberg for 14th, as Haas confirms the German is suffering with graining on the medium tyres.
2023-04-29T14:02:07Z: De Vries overtakes Bottas, suffering on the softs, for 15th, while Hulkenberg is sinking fast with his pace five seconds a lap slower than Magnussen.
2023-04-29T14:01:01Z: Perez has responded to Leclerc's pace to pull out to 1.2s clear, with the same sized gap splitting Leclerc to Verstappen.
2023-04-29T13:59:58Z: Ocon pits for the second time in this sprint, which is impressive in itself, as he takes on fresh softs.
2023-04-29T13:59:22Z: Leclerc is actually coming back on Perez now! He's broken clear of DRS range of Verstappen and is gaining DRS from Perez ahead. Five laps to go, but this one isn't over just yet.
2023-04-29T13:58:21Z: Magnussen has got ahead of team-mate Hulkenberg for 11th place, but they are well off the pace of the top 10.
2023-04-29T13:57:49Z: Leclerc is keeping Verstappen at bay, to his credit, as further back Stroll gets by Albon at Turn 1 for eighth place and the final points place in this sprint.
2023-04-29T13:56:12Z: Norris pits at the end of lap 10 - ditching his softs for mediums.
2023-04-29T13:55:39Z: Leclerc has lost DRS from Perez, but Verstappen has it from him, so you can probably guess what is coming next.
2023-04-29T13:54:55Z: The soft tyre gamble hasn't worked for Norris, who has now been overtaken by both Haas driver and drops to 13th.
2023-04-29T13:54:31Z: Leclerc is clinging on to DRS from Perez but he is gradually slipping back, which is bringing on Verstappen.
2023-04-29T13:53:09Z: Behind the leaders the positions aren't changing a huge deal, but Piastri has just got by team-mate Norris for 10th place.
2023-04-29T13:52:24Z: Leclerc, even with DRS, doesn't have the top speed to get back ahead of Perez. Verstappen isn't out of the fight at the front either as he pulls clear of Russell.
2023-04-29T13:50:36Z: With the aid of DRS Perez dives into the lead at Turn 1, but Leclerc is fighting back now he has DRS!
2023-04-29T13:49:49Z: Perez is stalking Leclerc, making sure he stays within one second to gain DRS for the main straight.
2023-04-29T13:48:51Z: DRS has been enabled at the start of lap seven, so this will really but pressure on leader Leclerc.
2023-04-29T13:48:02Z: Further back Norris lost a place to Stroll for ninth. It is all action at the restart, but all clean so far!
2023-04-29T13:47:13Z: Off we go again, Leclerc keeps the lead while Verstappen gets back by Russell for third, and Hamilton loses places to Sainz and Alonso!
2023-04-29T13:44:28Z: Tsunoda finally makes his way back into the pits and he retires the car. The debris has been cleared up and the safety car will be in at the end of lap five.
2023-04-29T13:43:15Z: Verstappen is told over team radio he has floor damage, picked up from his first-lap contact with Russell. He's far from happy, as you'd imagine.
2023-04-29T13:42:31Z: Behind the safety car Ocon pits to switch to the softs - he has nothing to lose having started from the pitlane. Tsunoda is still circulating on track, as the stewards announce he will be investigated after the race.
2023-04-29T13:41:16Z: Tsunoda has been noted for being released with his car in an unsafe condition.
2023-04-29T13:40:40Z: The full safety car has been deployed now. There is still a lot of debris on track.
2023-04-29T13:40:18Z: Tsunoda has come back out after changing tyres and getting a new front wing, but his car is crabbing sideways - how was that car allowed to return to the action?
2023-04-29T13:39:11Z: Under the virtual safety car, Leclerc leads from Perez with Russell in third having got ahead of Verstappen who wasn't happy with the Brit for his overtake when they made contact.
2023-04-29T13:38:23Z: Replays show Tsunoda clattered the wall without any major issue before it, as he limps back to the pits on three wheels.
2023-04-29T13:37:28Z: Tsunoda is out of the sprint, there is debris on track and the tyre is still rolling on the racing line as the virtual safety car is called.
2023-04-29T13:36:36Z: Tsunoda has lost his right-rear wheel at Turn 15 - and his tyre is rolling down the middle of the track!
2023-04-29T13:35:23Z: Leclerc makes a strong start to keep the lead ahead of Perez, as Verstappen clips wheels with Russell at Turn 2 and then concedes the place to the Mercedes.
2023-04-29T13:33:42Z: Leclerc takes his place in pole position as the rest of the grid lines up behind him... seconds out from lights out.
2023-04-29T13:32:37Z: Leclerc isn't hanging around leading the formation lap, trying to get as much heat and energy into his medium tyres for the start.
2023-04-29T13:30:37Z: The formation lap is under way. Here we go.
2023-04-29T13:29:16Z: So, keep an eye on Norris and Bottas throughout this race, they will have the quicker tyre at the start but then will be hanging on for performance in the closing laps.
2023-04-29T13:28:14Z: Tyre news: Mediums, and lots of them. Everyone apart from Norris (10th) and Bottas (15th) is on the mediums, while that pair start on softs.
2023-04-29T13:25:56Z: In the early years of racing in Baku, there was a theory that if there was a chaotic F2 race it meant for a safe F1 race. Given only half the F2 grid saw the chequered flag earlier, we'll see if the old adage rings true.
2023-04-29T13:22:27Z: The drivers are getting strapped into their cockpits with just under 10 minutes to go until lights out.
2023-04-29T13:20:15Z: The key to this sprint will actually be the opposite in name: endurance. The sprint race is 17 laps but throughout practice and qualifying in Baku nobody got close to completing that number of consecutive laps. So they are all going into the sprint partially blind.
2023-04-29T13:15:06Z: Quick refresher on the sprint races for 2023: This is the first sprint race weekend of six this year. The winner bags eight points, with the points being handed out down to eighth place. But unlike last year, the finishing order doesn't decide the grid for the grand prix.
2023-04-29T13:11:12Z: Given the top speed of the Red Bulls, can Leclerc really keep them behind him? It is a tall order, something the Ferrari driver eluded to both yesterday and today.
2023-04-29T13:09:43Z: Those changes won't impact the front half of the grid, so for both the sprint race and grand prix start it'll be Leclerc on pole against two charging Red Bulls directly behind him.
2023-04-29T13:06:21Z: The other key news post-qualifying is that Ocon will start both the sprint race and the grand prix from the pitlane due to Alpine taking the car out of parc ferme conditions to make changes. The French driver was due to start from 13th in the sprint.
2023-04-29T13:04:40Z: The US driver should be back in action with a repaired Williams for tomorrow's grand prix. But after an encouraging start to his Baku weekend, this will be a tough one to watch from the sidelines.
2023-04-29T13:03:40Z: The F1 drivers are leaving pitlane to head to the grid - but there will only be 19 of them taking part in the sprint, as Sargeant has been forced out due to damage sustained to his Williams during sprint qualifying.
2023-04-29T13:02:09Z: Afternoon one and all! It is Sprinty McSprint time, are you excited?
2023-04-29T09:39:20Z: So, Leclerc gets the honour of wearing the special Pirelli cap for becoming the inaugural sprint shootout winner - just what he always wanted. We're heading off for a bit now, but join us again at around 2:15pm BST to find out if Leclerc can keep the Red Bulls behind in the sprint. Bye for now.
2023-04-29T09:37:28Z: Here's the full report from another entertaining qualifying session at Baku: https://www.autosport.com/f1/news/f1-azerbaijan-gp-sprint-shootout-report/10462311/
2023-04-29T09:22:29Z: But there will be some disappointment at Aston as Alonso and Stroll are only eighth and ninth amid those continued DRS woes.
2023-04-29T09:21:57Z: So double pole for Leclerc! More joy for Ferrari (or one side of the garage at least) while Russell will be pleased with fourth after his Q1 elimination yesterday.
2023-04-29T09:20:43Z: Leclerc lost the rear heading into Turn 5 and nudged into the wall, doing less damage than Sargeant earlier - so there shouldn't be any concerns about gearbox penalties for this one!
2023-04-29T09:20:03Z: Great effort from Russell as he climbs to fourth to just pip Sainz. And Albon is seventh ahead of both Astons.
2023-04-29T09:19:26Z: Oh and Leclerc is in the wall at Turn 5! But it doesn't matter as Perez and Verstappen stay second and third.
2023-04-29T09:18:27Z: Perez does not improve in the first sector and neither is Verstappen! This is looking good for Leclerc and Ferrari.
2023-04-29T09:17:51Z: Right, this is it - one final flier. One final battle for pole this weekend!
2023-04-29T09:17:13Z: And we've got some nonsense here as Perez is massively backing the pack up on this cooldown lap.
2023-04-29T09:16:20Z: The drivers might now go for a cooldown lap before one more attempt, if they have enough fuel for that.
2023-04-29T09:15:11Z: And Leclerc goes to provisional pole! It's a 1m41.697s to go two tenths quicker than Perez. Sainz is only fourth.
2023-04-29T09:14:36Z: Albon is currently fifth ahead of both Astons, which are still struggling with DRS.
2023-04-29T09:14:17Z: Perez sets the opening effort and it's a 1m41.876s that's three tenths quicker than Verstappen! Not a great lap for the world champion, losing out in the middle sector.
2023-04-29T09:13:38Z: Verstappen is purple in sector one but we will have to wait for the Ferraris to set their times.
2023-04-29T09:12:18Z: After being unsuccessful in his efforts, Hamilton now drops back - but not exactly ideal preparation for the Mercedes driver.
2023-04-29T09:11:46Z: Hamilton is desperately trying to get past Albon but to no avail - remember these two have a history of clashing...
2023-04-29T09:11:15Z: Leclerc and Sainz do now join the fray, while it's the Red Bulls once again leading the field around.
2023-04-29T09:10:53Z: Everyone bar Norris and the Ferraris instantly heads out for this one.
2023-04-29T09:10:29Z: So we're off and the second Baku pole position shootout is under way!
2023-04-29T09:08:39Z: But Norris won't able to take part in this one because he doesn't have any new soft tyres that are mandated in this session, so Albon will therefore be starting at least ninth for the sprint race.
2023-04-29T09:07:33Z: The Red Bulls have already headed out with three minutes to go before this session begins.
2023-04-29T09:07:08Z: Alonso played a big part in helping Stroll get through at the end there as he gave Stroll a huge tow down the pit straight.
2023-04-29T09:05:37Z: Sainz improved again late on to go third, but he's still four tenths off his team-mate as he continues to be some distance behind Leclerc.
2023-04-29T09:05:11Z: Great job for Albon as he gets through for Williams in ninth, while Norris is again in the top 10 shootout.
2023-04-29T09:04:48Z: So, that's it, Piastri, Hulkenberg, Ocon, Magnussen and the crashed Sargeant out.
2023-04-29T09:04:31Z: Hulkenberg improves but it's not enough, while Piastri jumps out of the top 10, but quickly gets shuffled back out by Stroll.
2023-04-29T09:03:54Z: Hamilton improves to fifth late on, while Ocon bails into the pits so Alpine's misery continues.
2023-04-29T09:03:17Z: The chequered flag is now out and with Magnussen in the pits, he's certainly out.
2023-04-29T09:02:56Z: Sainz is the latest one in trouble as he goes straight on at Turn 15 but keeps out of the walls.
2023-04-29T09:02:37Z: Leclerc improves again but stays second - although he's now just a tenth slower than Verstappen.
2023-04-29T09:01:37Z: Sure enough, Russell now jumps up to seventh so it's Ocon, Piastri and the Haases in danger of elimination.
2023-04-29T09:01:11Z: Russell is in a bit of trouble here, he's only 11th at the minute and on a better lap this time around.
2023-04-29T08:59:54Z: Alonso now jumps up to fourth with his latest effort as everyone bar pacesetter Verstappen stays out.
2023-04-29T08:58:33Z: Leclerc's opening effort is a 1m42.812s, which puts him second but four tenths slower than Verstappen.
2023-04-29T08:58:04Z: It's Hulkenberg, who caused the earlier yellow as he locked up but, just, kept it out of the barriers.
2023-04-29T08:57:32Z: But the leading contenders were already through that part of the course and Verstappen sets the early benchmark with a 1m42.417s to go half a second quicker than Perez.
2023-04-29T08:56:49Z: We've got a yellow already! This one in sector two.
2023-04-29T08:54:25Z: So, without Gasly, everyone else has now headed out in this session - with the exception of the stricken Williams of Sargeant.
2023-04-29T08:53:12Z: More trouble for Alonso as he's still suffering with DRS problems, which is not what you want on some of the long straights of Baku.
2023-04-29T08:51:39Z: Unusually, it's the Red Bulls at the head of the queue. But, given this session is only 10 minutes, they're probably wary of further red flags.
2023-04-29T08:50:50Z: And we've now got a stream of cars pouring out the garages with over two minutes to go before the start of the session!
2023-04-29T08:50:03Z: Right, so sprint qualifying will resume at 1253 local time - in three minutes, in other words.
2023-04-29T08:49:05Z: A furious radio response from Tsunoda as he's told of the red flag, just as he was about to set a time that could have got him out of the drop zone.
2023-04-29T08:47:50Z: Unsurprisingly, given that crash, the start of SQ2 - as the next segment is called - has been delayed.
2023-04-29T08:45:59Z: There's a fair bit of damage to that Williams, this could affect the gearbox and engine as well - so will be a major blow for the team. They've now got four hours to get that sorted for the sprint race.
2023-04-29T08:44:23Z: Replays show Sargeant clouted the wall on the outside of the corner, possibly distracted by some slow Ferraris on the inside.
2023-04-29T08:43:42Z: It was a hefty hit for Sargeant, so Williams is the latest crew with plenty of work on its hands. He was 11th in that session, so it's a missed opportunity for the American.
2023-04-29T08:43:01Z: So, Zhou, Bottas, Tsunoda, Gasly and de Vries are the five drivers out - not any huge surprises there.
2023-04-29T08:42:37Z: With just 25s on the clock when Sargeant clouted the Turn 15 wall, that's the end of the session.
2023-04-29T08:42:18Z: First one of the day and it's Sargeant - who had been doing so well for Williams. He's clouted the wall and done a fair bit of damage to the rear.
2023-04-29T08:41:52Z: And here we go, a red flag!
2023-04-29T08:41:04Z: Others on danger of joining him are the two Alfas and AlphaTauris, while Hulkenberg is on the bubble in 15th with two minutes to go.
2023-04-29T08:40:40Z: More misery for Gasly as he's only 19th and is in the pits, so he will be eliminated here.
2023-04-29T08:40:25Z: And Leclerc improves again to go nearly half a second quicker than Verstappen!
2023-04-29T08:39:26Z: Hamilton now shoots up to second to go two tenths slower than Leclerc and fractionally quicker than Verstappen - for now.
2023-04-29T08:38:54Z: Williams is showing some impressive pace and Albon and Sargeant are now up to third and fourth.
2023-04-29T08:38:31Z: De Vries is the latest driver to be caught out at Turn 3 as he goes straight on. Unlike yesterday, when he clouted the barriers, he is able to continue this time.
2023-04-29T08:37:16Z: Stroll and Alonso are now up to third and fourth but are almost a second off the leading pace.
2023-04-29T08:36:49Z: For those wondering about the yellow flag earlier, it was Piastri who went straight on at Turn 3 into the runoff and kept it out of the barriers.
2023-04-29T08:36:24Z: And now tomorrow's polesitter Leclerc shoots to the top with a 1m43.372s to go two tenths quicker.
2023-04-29T08:35:58Z: But that effort on the medium tyres is quickly shaded by Perez, who goes slightly quicker, before Verstappen pulverises the time with a 1m43.563s.
2023-04-29T08:35:05Z: Hamilton now climbs to the top of the times with a 1m44.739s.
2023-04-29T08:34:28Z: That has quickly cleared now and the Williams drivers are the first to post a time.
2023-04-29T08:33:32Z: And we have a yellow flag at Turn 3 already!
2023-04-29T08:31:59Z: And that remaining quintet now venture out - so we've got a full track with just over 10 minutes to go.
2023-04-29T08:31:17Z: So, we've quickly got a flood of cars heading out. Everyone bar the two Red Bulls, Ferraris and Gasly so far.
2023-04-29T08:30:18Z: And we're off! The inaugural sprint qualifying session begins!
2023-04-29T08:29:15Z: And it's chaotic in the pitlane as a huge queue of cars has already lined up!
2023-04-29T08:28:52Z: As a reminder, this first part of qualifying is due to last a slightly shorter 12 minutes. So, expect a chaotic session!
2023-04-29T08:27:05Z: So, three minutes until the session is due to begin - what surprises have we got in store in this one? Time to find out.
2023-04-29T08:25:19Z: Here's the obligatory weather update for you, and there's not much to say! Risk of rain in this session is 0% and air temp is currently 24 degrees Celsius.
2023-04-29T08:21:59Z: Given the likelihood of a red flag in Baku, it's no wonder new proposals are being rushed through...
2023-04-29T08:21:13Z: The new format for this sprint event was only agreed days ago, but there are potentially more changes afoot as it's emerged F1 restart rules could be tweaked from today. Here's the latest on this developing story: https://www.autosport.com/f1/news/fia-set-to-modify-red-flag-restart-procedure-for-baku-f1-sprint/10462245/
2023-04-29T08:17:34Z: One team hoping things will be different is Aston Martin. Alonso was 'only' sixth yesterday as both he and Stroll (in ninth) struggled without DRS. He'll be hoping they've shaken off those woes for today: https://www.autosport.com/f1/news/alonso-rues-aston-martin-drs-issue-in-baku-f1-qualifying/10461951/
2023-04-29T08:16:05Z: Yesterday's main qualifying was a thriller, with Leclerc and Verstappen heading into the final runs tied on identical times before the Ferrari man nudged ahead at the end. But today is a new day and things could be different this time around. Here's a recap of yesterday's session, in case you missed it: https://www.autosport.com/f1/news/f1-azerbaijan-gp-leclerc-beats-red-bulls-for-grand-prix-pole/10461826/
2023-04-29T08:15:02Z: That's the theory, anyway, but given we're at the notoriously tricky Baku circuit - and it took 45 minutes to complete Q1 alone yesterday with two red flags - who knows what could happen!
2023-04-29T08:14:06Z: This session is due to last around 45 minutes, and will adopt the regular Q1, Q2 and Q3 knockout format - except each segment will be shorter than in a usual qualifying hour.
2023-04-29T08:12:26Z: Now, for those of you getting a sense of deja vu, yes we have already had qualifying in Baku! But this latest session is setting the grid for this afternoon's sprint race and has no impact on tomorrow's grand prix.
2023-04-29T08:12:00Z: Hello and welcome to our coverage of Sprint Saturday of the Azerbaijan GP event! Qualifying is due to begin in just under 20 minutes.
